txt.en: 'Hail and well met, friend [placeholder]. It appears our paths run along similar courses. I did not believe things had become so dire within the borders of the Riddermark, but I see from the Orc-encampment outside Eaworth that the situation here is worse than I imagined.\n\n'I am sore distressed to bring word of the Khundolar to Reeve Ingbert, but if he does not join in the muster, I fear the Eastemnet will fall. Will you accompany me to meet with him?'
'The situation here is far worse than I imagined. If we do not help the Reeve against these Orcs, I fear Eaworth and the Entwash Vale will fall!'
'Let us meet with the Reeve and see what he has to say.'
The Reeve of the Entwash Vale
You have met up once more with the Riders Four outside the Mead Hall of Eaworth.
Burnoth has agreed to help the Reeve in exchange for a conscription to the muster of the Eastemnet
Talk to Burnoth to accompany him into the Mead Hall of Eaworth
Burnoth awaits you outside the Mead Hall of Eaworth.\n\nYou should speak with Burnoth when you are ready to accompany him into the Mead Hall.
Talk to Burnoth outside the Mead Hall of Eaworth
Burnoth awaits you outside the Mead Hall of Eaworth.\n\nYou should speak with Burnoth regarding Reeve Ingbert's response.
